description: The round payoff this round was 5. You, Kate chose to play option 1.John chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 0.
Mutual cooperation (option 1) avoids penalties and stabilizes payoffs, as seen in the 2024-01-02 round where both chose option 1 and received 0
The game strongly disincentivizes mutual defection (option 2) due to the 1000x input penalty, making coordination on option 1 critical
Repeated interactions incentivize trust-building to sustain cooperation, as deviations risk triggering retaliatory defection and massive losses
Temptation to defect (option 2) exists for short-term gains, but the asymmetric payoffs and repetition discourage exploitation
Higher round inputs amplify the stakes, requiring greater caution to avoid mutual defection
